alert.note: Alert for Lemhi (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 15 at 8:59PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Increased risk of ice jam flooding as air sub zero temperatures moderate... Where: Salmon River 8 to 13 miles north of Salmon When: During the second half of January, particularly once air temperatures warm near freezing What: Recent sub zero temperatures have allowed river ice to develop within the Salmon River just north of Salmon, Idaho. Trained river spotters have noted two distinct areas of ice build-up: near 8 miles north of Salmon, and near 12 miles north of Salmon. The continuation of sub zero temperatures and the eventual warm-up over the next couple of weeks will allow river ice to move around and may quickly jam up water flow, resulting in lowland flooding. More information will be provided as river ice continues to proliferate and temperatures begin to warm.
